newsitem.title: USA: Murphy Oil producing 2 Gulf of Mexico wells.
newsitem.headline: Murphy Oil producing 2 Gulf of Mexico wells.

text.p: Murphy Oil Corp said Tuesday production has recently commenced from the first two wells in its new West Cameron Block 631 field in the Gulf of Mexico.
Current production totals 110 million cubic feet of natural gas and 1,400 barrels of condensate per day. Additional delineation drilling is currently under way.
It is planned to produce the field at a sustained rate of approximately 80 million cubic feet of natural gas and 1,000 barrels of condensate per day for the remainder of the year, the company said.

West Cameron Block 631 is located in 325 feet of water approximately 125 miles south of Cameron, La. Murphy is the operator of the block and has a 60-percent working interest. The remaining 40-percent interest is held by CNG Producing Co, a subsidiary of Pittsburgh-based Consolidated Natural Gas Co.
